  • View page source

NetScriptGen TutorialÂ¶

In this tutorial, we will cover everything you need for generate your scripts. First, you will learn how to store the data in an Excel Workbook, and secondly, how to write a template. There are some practical examples for more understanding.

Before we begin, make sure that the following prerequisites are met :

  • You have already installed NetScriptGen
  • You must have Microsoft Excel version 2010 or higher (respects the XML standard)
  • You are drinking a smooth coffee

Contents:

  • The Excel Workbook
    • The global worksheet
    • The feature worksheet
    • The joint between the global worksheet and a feature worksheet
    • Fixed common variables
    • How to store a text ?
  • The Global Template
    • Retrieving data from the Global worksheet
    • Retrieving data within a table from any worksheet
    • Retrieving value of fixed common variables
    • Retrieving a text
